title: IoT & Cloud Researcher
description: • Developed data visualization and analysis platform for predictive, hyperlocal weather reports to improve crop yield with C++, Python, PostgreSQL, and React.

title: Processor Design Researcher
description: • Designed and simulated 2 RISC-V processors in PyRTL (similar to Verilog) featured in a department-wide presentation.
• Contrived 4 countermeasures against hardware-level cyberattacks and performed a security/performance audit.

title: Software Engineering Intern
description: Spent three summers working on various projects, many of which are in currently in production. I learned about developing software for real-world use cases and designing code that can be easily extended by other developers.
• Created financial and legal advice chat bots and framework; $80,000 in funding allocated for content creation.
• Produced a step-by-step wizard to guide users through complex real estate forms online, integrated with ZipLogix through RESTful web services, allowing users to fill forms 3x faster.
• Devised a blockchain-based distributed file system in Python and Solidity (on Ethereum) as a proof of concept for secure storage of property data as a new industry standard.
• Built a full-stack web application to capture text, voice, and images to generate and populate 10+ real estate forms.
• Designed IVR/web-based systems with AWS to handle password resets, eliminating former #1 call center task.
Each project was accompanied by a binder of documentation to ensure maintainability in the future.

title: IT Systems Intern
description: Much of the healthcare industry relies on paper documents and fax machines. I bridged the gap between new and aging systems, reduced manual entry, and freed coworkers so they could do what they do best.
• Programmed Python scripts to automate tasks and B2B transactions, eliminating 30% of employee workloads.
• Streamlined paperless operations and consolidated workflows, improving productivity by 200%+.
• Achieved HIPAA compliance in data storage with encryption and tiered access protocols, passing 2 external audits.

title: Head of Design & Programming
description: • Managed team of 10+ students to design, program, and test robots in annual FIRST Robotics Competition.
• Coordinated implementation of control theory and autonomous driving routines in Java.
• Won #1 Highest Rookie Seed Award for performance in qualifying rounds.
